title: Talia Benheim
text: I am a PhD student in Health Services Research with a concentration in Health Economics at Brown University School of Public Health. My research aims to improve care quality and continuity for individuals with complex health needs. I have particular interests in nursing home staffing dynamics, post-acute care transitions, and the integration of mental/behavioral health services across various care settings. Prior to my doctoral studies, I worked as a clinical research coordinator in the Department of Psychiatry at Massachusetts General Hospital. I received my bachelor’s degree in Economics and Psychology from Wellesley College in 2021.

title: Research
text:
Work in progress

Hospital-skilled nursing facility dynamics in access to post-acute care for people with opioid use disorder
Benheim TS, Rahman MS, Zullo A, Ritter A, Kimmel SD, Dow PM

title: Talia Benheim
text:
I am a Ph.D. student in the Department of Health Services, Policy, and Practice at Brown University School of Public Health.
My research interests include mental health and substance use services, post-acute and long-term care, and the healthcare workforce.
Please feel free to get in touch!
